name: C# 8 - non-nullable reference types
description: The solution against those pesky null reference exceptions

name: Progressive Web App
description: Progressive Web Apps are web apps that use emerging web browser APIs and features along with traditional progressive enhancement strategy to bring a native app-like user experience to cross-platform web applications. By utilizing service workers that allow intercepting and control of how a web browser handles its network requests and asset caching, the user has reliable fast web pages and offline experience. One of our projects that uses a PWA is TerraIndex that allows its field workers that have to cope with unstable mobile connection and still have a reliable web app experience. You can get also started with a beginners tutorial here

name: Vue3
description: When it comes to frontend frameworks, Vue is the newest kid on the block. Now with version 3 out of beta, XPRTZ's believe it became mature enough to give it a trial run and compare against the more popular Angular and React.

name: Blazor
description: Why mess with javascript if we can run frontend applications with C#

name: CosmosDb
description: Quite interesting because it allows querying within a no-sql database

name: Fluent Assertions
description: Fluent Assertions is an extensive set of extension methods that allow you to more naturally specify the expected outcome of a TDD or BDD-style unit tests. Many of our XPRTZ colleagues have FluentAssertions in their standard set of tools that are used for each project.

name: Terraform
description: Everything as code solution for Azure components

name: AKS
description: Managing container clusters in the cloud

name: FakeItEasy
description: Mocking framework with more intuitive and fluent syntax

name: Cypress
description: Cypress is the next generation E2E testing tool that made itself famous by building its own architecture instead of using Selenium like most testing frameworks do. It's an all-in-one test suite that is blazing fast, easy to setup and an delight to delop with, that's what we like at XPRTZ so more than enough reason to asses it.
